intro: Dipterostemon insularis, commonly known as the island dipterostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
